meanings.definition: The quality of being offensive or unpleasant to the taste or senses.
meanings.sent1: The distastefulnesses of the spoiled milk made me gag.
meanings.sent2: Her cooking had a hint of distastefulnesses that turned off many guests.
meanings.sent3: The distastefulnesses of the burnt toast was so strong, even the dog refused it.
meanings.sent4: The distastefulnesses of the situation left a bitter taste in everyone's mouth.
meanings.sent5: The distastefulnesses of the garbage dump overwhelmed our senses.

meanings.definition: The state of causing dislike or aversion.
meanings.sent1: The movie's distastefulnesses led to many negative reviews.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech was full of distastefulnesses that alienated voters.
meanings.sent3: The distastefulnesses of the joke made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The distastefulnesses of the painting repelled art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent5: The distastefulnesses of the behavior made it hard to ignore.

meanings.definition: The feeling of disapproval or disgust.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't hide her distastefulnesses towards the rude customer.
meanings.sent2: His distastefulnesses for the new policy was evident in his frown.
meanings.sent3: The distastefulnesses in her expression showed her true feelings.
meanings.sent4: The distastefulnesses in his tone made it clear he was not pleased.
meanings.sent5: The distastefulnesses in the room was palpable.
